SEARCH
Package com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview

Class SmartGraphVertexNode<T>

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.Group
com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview.SmartGraphVertexNode<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the underlying vertex
All Implemented Interfaces:
SmartGraphVertex<T>, SmartLabelledNode, SmartStylableNode, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class SmartGraphVertexNode<T> extends javafx.scene.Group implements SmartGraphVertex<T>, SmartLabelledNode
Internal implementation of a graph vertex for the SmartGraphPanel class.
Visually it depicts a vertex as a circle, extending from Circle.
The vertex internally deals with mouse drag events that visually move it in the SmartGraphPanel when displayed, if parameterized to do so.
Author:
brunomnsilva
See Also:
  • SmartGraphPanel

  • Constructor Details

    • SmartGraphVertexNode

      public SmartGraphVertexNode(SmartGraphPanel<?,?> parent, Vertex<T> v, double x, double y, double radius, String shapeType, boolean allowMove, boolean labelInside)
      Constructor which sets the instance attributes.
      Parameters:
      v - the underlying vertex
      x - initial x position on the parent pane
      y - initial y position on the parent pane
      radius - radius of this vertex representation
      shapeType - type of the shape to represent this vertex, see ShapeFactory
      allowMove - should the vertex be draggable with the mouse
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if shapeType is invalid or if x or y or radius are negative.

    • setShapeType

      public void setShapeType(String shapeType)
      Changes the shape used to represent this node.
      When "swapping" shapes, the new shape will retain the positioning, radius and styling of the previous shape.
      Parameters:
      shapeType - the shape type name. See ShapeFactory.

    • setStyleInline

      public void setStyleInline(String css)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies cumulatively the css inline styles to the node.
      These inline JavaFX styles have higher priority and are not overwritten by any css classes set by SmartStylableNode.addStyleClass(java.lang.String). But will be discarded if you use SmartStylableNode.setStyleClass(java.lang.String)
      If you need to clear any previously set inline styles, use .setStyleInline(null). Not that this will clear all inline styles previously applied.
      Specified by:
      setStyleInline in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      css - styles

    • setStyleClass

      public void setStyleClass(String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.
      The cssClass string must not contain a preceding dot, e.g., "myClass" instead of ".myClass".
      The CSS Class must be defined in smartgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.
      The expected behavior is to remove all current styling before applying the class css.
      Specified by:
      setStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • addStyleClass

      public void addStyleClass(String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Applies cumulatively the CSS styling defined in class selector cssClass.
      The CSS Class must be defined in smartgraph.css file or in the custom provided stylesheet.
      The cumulative operation will overwrite any existing styling elements previously defined for previous classes.
      Specified by:
      addStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.

    • removeStyleClass

      public boolean removeStyleClass(String cssClass)
      Description copied from interface: SmartStylableNode
      Removes a previously cssClass existing CSS styling.
      Given styles can be added sequentially, the removal of a css class will be a removal that keeps the previous ordering of kept styles.
      Specified by:
      removeStyleClass in interface SmartStylableNode
      Parameters:
      cssClass - name of the CSS class.
      Returns:
      true if successful; false if cssClass wasn't previously set.
